intro: Eschweilera romeu-cardosoi, commonly known as the Ribeirão Preto ceiba, is a tropical tree native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, buttressed roots and smooth, grayish bark. The tree produces showy, cream-colored flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, lowland areas and plays an important ecological role in its native habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
